description: From Middle English slombere, slomerer, slummerare, equivalent to slumber +â€Ž -er.

examples: His right arm he thrust out towards the east, / Westward his left; th' ends did themselves digest / Into ten lesser strings, these fingers were: / And as a slumberer stretching on his bed, / This way he this, and that way scattered / His other leg, which feet with toes upbear;
